page.title: 14LITTLE MALVERN PRIORY+COURT
page.content: Founded in 1171 (some say 1150) its local history has nothing to do with Malvern Priory. It was an offshoot from the{Benedictine monastery at {Worcester}which used it as a prison of religion for 'baddie monks'.Today only the{chancel, tower and transept remain. At the Dissolution much of the fabric of the domestic buidings went to those who grabbed the current opportunity. Today's{Little Malvern {Priory and Court}comprises what remains of the old domestic and {monastic buildings}- the refectory and prior's hall are part of the current house.{Priest holes and recusant {hideouts}in the buildings witness their importance during times of religious unrest. The present residents - the{Berrington family}- have done much serious, sensible reconstruction.
